image.altText: Sue La Velle

props.synopsis: Photos and a box of ashes are all Sue La Velle has after her son was found dead in a Melbourne home in June. She's sharing her story for the first time in the hope it will prevent others from meeting the same fate.

title.children: A synthetic opioid more potent than fentanyl is spreading across Australia with fatal consequences

image.altText: People waiting at a train station.

props.synopsis: Queensland will benefit from cheaper public transport permanently, if the state government is re-elected, after the "huge success" of its trial of 50 cent fares.

title.children: Other states enquiring about 50 cent public transport fares as QLD government promises to keep it 'forever'

image.altText: A blurred photo of trucks and a motorhome driving on the Bruce Highway

props.synopsis: "The Bruce" is being labelled a national disgrace, pock-marked with dangerous potholes and signposted with memorials to people who have died on the notorious road.

title.children: The national highway that some drivers say is more like a 'goat track' — with deadly consequences

image.altText: An aboriginal man looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Brian never had cake on his birthday as a child, just "hidings" every other day. He is one of many Indigenous people providing testimony to Queensland's Truth-Telling and Healing Inquiry.

title.children: 'What's a mother?': The story of the boy who never had a birthday cake

image.altText: A young teen with braces, a wide-brimmed hat and agriculture show ribbons on her shoulders smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Amy Ballinger hates to think of the consequences if the persecution she suffered had followed her home. As her own children start school she wants them banned from social media until they're 16.

title.children: Bullies made school hell for Amy. Now she's a mum backing a new social media age limit

image.altText: An older man with white hair smiles, he is holding a small fluffy dog which looks happy and standing front of a row of bins

props.synopsis: Animal-loving retiree Selwyn "Nuts" Nutley has recycled more than a million cans and bottles in his small Queensland town, raising more than $100,000 for a pet rescue service that would have gone under without him.

title.children: In his 80s with a love of rescue dogs, 'Nuts' has cashed in more than a million empties for charity

image.altText: A man in a scraggly beard and a teenage boy shrugs as two well-groomed rats scurry across their shoulders.

props.synopsis: A job, a return to school, and a veggie garden are some of the things this family is looking forward to now that they have a place to call home.

title.children: Kenny found being homeless went hand in hand with being jobless, but the tide is finally turning for him

image.altText: Jane Hume at senate estimates

props.synopsis: The Coalition has confirmed it will walk away entirely from the key recommendation of an independent review of the Reserve Bank of Australia.

title.children: Coalition walks back in-principle support for restructuring RBA board

image.altText: A crosssection of vanilla slice on a plate with a mans blurred face in the background

props.synopsis: Each year chef Jan Slottje packs up her home in Brisbane to spend eight months running this remote outback kitchen, and her sweet delicacies have tourists drooling.

title.children: You might not expect Hell's Gate to be filled with tempting sweet treats, but the proof is in the tasting

image.altText: A car crash scene at night with emergency vehicles on road and red and blue lights

props.synopsis: Two fatal crashes occurred within hours of police launching a statewide road safety initiative targeting unsafe driving behaviours during the busy travel period.

title.children: Horror start to school holidays as three people die on Queensland roads

image.altText: A graphic depicting an American flag that has been torn in half, with a shadow hanging over it.

props.synopsis: Of all the schisms that cleave contemporary America, few are more stark than the divide between those who consider themselves to be victims of US history and those who fear they will be casualties of its future.

title.children: America is on the verge of something fateful, but it cannot escape history

image.altText: A chair lift at the bottom of a set of household stairs.

props.synopsis: Older Australians being cared for at home will be able to apply for a new $25,000 palliative support payment when they have three months of life left under the government's aged care overhaul.

title.children: A new $25,000 support payment seeks to make it easier for people to die at home

image.altText: A birds eye view of the river coming down

props.synopsis: The mesmerising transformation of parched sand giving way to the rush of fresh, flowing water has people across a vast outback region in awe as it carves a path from the bush to the sea.

title.children: After weeks of relentless rain, this once-dry riverbed begins to brim with life-giving water

image.altText: Storm debris covers Stanwell Park beach

props.synopsis: There are growing signs Australia's most impactful climate driver, La Niña, will develop during the coming months.

title.children: Latest modelling tips fourth La Niña for Australia in five years before year's end

image.altText: An overhead shot of two swags set up on a white sandy beach with crystal clear blue waters behind

props.synopsis: Most tourists visit well-known Great Keppel Island, but smaller national park islands like its neighbour, Middle, are becoming increasingly popular amid the cost of living crisis.

title.children: 'What dreams are made of': The Queensland islands you can have all to yourself for as little as $30 a night

image.altText: A woman with brown hair in a ponytail sitting outside a motel room

props.synopsis: Jessica Davies's family is one of many living in a motel while waiting for permanent accommodation. She says the arrangement is "not suitable" — but it's better than living in a tent.

title.children: 'Takes a very big toll': Housing crisis forces mum of four to live out of motel room

image.altText: Flood-affected residents wait for a rescue boat to pick them up.

props.synopsis: The death toll in Myanmar in the wake of Typhoon Yagi jumps to more than 70 a day after the junta makes a rare request for foreign aid.

title.children: Storms and flooding in Myanmar after Typhoon Yagi leave 74 dead

image.altText: A moustached middle-aged South American man thanks a crowd as he wears a red, yellow and blue starred jacket

props.synopsis: The US government denied claims of a plot to overthrow the Venezuelan government after a member of the US military was confirmed to be detained.

title.children: Venezuela arrests Spanish and US citizens accused of plot to kill president Maduro

image.altText: A woman in tears sits next to a young girl.

props.synopsis: A series of mass evictions has uprooted entire communities in the Pacific Island nation as people move to its urban fringes — and the government is looking for answers.

title.children: 'My heart was in pain': Vanuatu's mass evictions are leaving families in limbo

image.altText: A redheaded man with a beard

props.synopsis: As Harry turns 40, he has not only transitioned from the cheeky spare into a husband and father, he has increasingly aligned himself with Diana's family over the House of Windsor.

title.children: Harry at 40: Why the prince is now firmly aligned with Diana's wealthy family of rebels

image.altText: A woman wearing red sunglasses

props.synopsis: Clover Moore says she is set to serve a record sixth term as lord mayor after the local government elections across NSW.

title.children: City of Sydney Lord Mayor Clover Moore says council election could be her last amid sixth term prospect

image.altText: A man in a blue blazer smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: For the better part of 70 years, Claude Jeanneret has been keeping Surfers Paradise beach safe. As another patrol season starts, Surf Life Saving Australia has released its latest "alarming" drowning statistics.

title.children: Claude joined his surf lifesaving club during WWII. Almost 70 years later he's still on the beach

props.synopsis: Flewnt and Inkabee were lauded for their 'mesmerising' performance on America's Got Talent. But a social media photo prompted a very different reaction in Australia.

title.children: A Perth father and son hip-hop duo shone on America's Got Talent. Then came the online trolls

image.altText: A Sudanese refugee stands in front of rows of people sitting on the ground in Chad.

props.synopsis: Death, displacement, famine, and the collapse of most government and public infrastructure -- that's been the experience of the ongoing civil war in Sudan.

title.children: With 10 million displaced, some call it the forgotten war. These numbers explain the conflict in Sudan

image.altText: A house destroyed by fire.

props.synopsis: A house fire in Adelaide's north-east claims the life of a 74-year-old man, who was found unconscious inside the home but could not be revived, emergency services say.

title.children: 74yo man dies in house fire at Gilles Plains, after woman injured in separate blaze sparked by cigarettes

image.altText: A tank flying the flag of Israel drives on a street surrounded by destroyed buildings.

props.synopsis: An IDF air strike on a Gaza City house where displaced Palestinians were taking refuge has killed 11 people, Gaza's civil defence ministry said.

title.children: Israeli strike on Gaza City home kills 11 people, civil defence agency says

image.altText: Laura Loomer in focus in the foreground; Donald Trump blurred in the background.

props.synopsis: Laura Loomer joined US presidential candidate Donald Trump's campaign trial this week, attending his presidential debate against Kamala Harris and joining him for a 9/11 memorial service.

title.children: Who is Laura Loomer, the far-right activist Republicans fear is influencing Donald Trump with 'garbage' tactics?

image.altText: Ben Carroll talking to the government.

props.synopsis: The federal government has offered to lift its funding share for public schools, but Victoria has rejected the offer in a situation the state's education minister has described as "difficult".

title.children: Victoria rejects federal government school funding offer, creating a 'difficult' stalemate

image.altText: Australian wheelchair athlete Madison de Rozario pushes her chair across a bridge during a marathon race.

props.synopsis: Australian wheelchair racing great Madison de Rozario claims a dominant victory at the Sydney Marathon to complete back-to-back wins in the race.

title.children: Madison de Rozario defends title in Sydney Marathon

image.altText: A woman putting on lipstick while looking in a mirror backstage of a theatre.

props.synopsis: Behind the velvet curtain of a dimly lit stage, a group of mothers is preparing to shine. By day, they're doing the school run, but by night they perform burlesque.

title.children: For these mums, burlesque provides friendship, freedom and a strict 'no-judgement zone'

image.altText: A woman wearing a cap holdings a long brown basket on her back while she picks green leaves.

props.synopsis: Sri Lanka's tea industry grapples with a steep wage hike, but some estate owners embrace new approaches to balance worker welfare and productivity in a bid to save the sector.

title.children: Sri Lanka supplies most of Australia's tea, but its industry is now at a crossroad

image.altText: A woman on a horse in the ocean

props.synopsis: Andrew McCarthy has spent more than a decade combining his two loves — horses and the ocean — while putting a sleepy Queensland beach side town firmly on the tourism map.

title.children: Tourists from 'all over the world' have ridden horses on this beach, but it's time to hang up the reins

image.altText: A man creating street art in an alleyway

props.synopsis: With its laneways a hotspot for tourists, Melbourne City Council walks a fine line of encouraging the street art scene while keeping the taggers to a minimum.

title.children: Is it art or is it a crime? These are the rules of street art in Australia's graffiti capital

image.altText: An illustration of a well-dressed 18th century man with words in the background

props.synopsis: Colonial Australian John Lang lived a life of dramatic highs and lows, and he may have been the first Australian novelist. He is celebrated in India, but still largely unknown on our shores.

title.children: This novel has murky origins. It could have a momentous place in Australian history

image.altText: A Black woman in street clothes instructs young dancers in ballet outfits

props.synopsis: Ballet dancer Michaela Mabinty DePrince, who was raised in an orphanage in war-torn Sierra Leone, is being remembered as "a beautiful person, a wonderful dancer".

title.children: Ballerina Michaela Mabinty DePrince, who grew up in a Sierra Leone orphanage, dies aged 29
